summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to American Airlines, requesting travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell and three other individuals (names redacted) for two time periods (1994-1998 and July 2019 onward). It includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure and a declaration of custodian of records form. The subpoena is part of a federal criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Listed as an individual for whom American Airlines passenger and other records are being subpoenaed for the periods 1994-1998 and July 2019 onward.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Date by which American Airlines is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: Date the grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to American Airlines on January 23, 2020, seeking travel and payment records for Ghislaine Maxwell and three other redacted individuals.
The subpoena seeks records for two distinct time periods: January 1, 1994, through December 31, 1998, and from July 1, 2019, through the date of service.

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal law, specifically citing statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested American Airlines not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.
The document indicates an active federal criminal investigation into sex trafficking and related offenses was ongoing as of January 2020, targeting Maxwell's travel patterns.
